intro: Triphora surinamensis, commonly known as the Surinam triphora, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
